intro: Serapias levantina, commonly known as the Levant orchid, is a flowering plant native to the Mediterranean region. It belongs to the family Orchidaceae and is characterized by its striking, brightly colored flowers that resemble orchids. The plant typically grows in rocky or gravelly soils and thrives in sunny, well-drained environments. Its flowers are usually yellow or orange with intricate patterns, and it blooms in late spring to early summer. Serapias levantina is a perennial herb that is often found in mountainous areas of southern Europe and North Africa.
